edu.ncsu.csc216.shipping_simulator.simulation

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.shipping_simulator.simulation.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulator class runs the simulation step-by-step. It controls the adding and leaving of packages into the simulation And it uses a Log to gather data from each package.
    Author:
    Aurora Bravo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulator(int numStations, int numShipments)
      Constructor for Simulator class.

      Average number of seconds items spent in actual processing.

      Average number of seconds items had to wait in a shipment process station line prior to their actual processing.

      Returns index of ShipmentProcessStations selected by the currentShipment, or -1 if currentShipment is null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(int numStations,
                 int numShipments)
        Constructor for Simulator class. It initializes the number of shipments and number of stations to the parameter's value. It also sets stepsTaken to zero, currentShipment to null. It creates a Log, a ShipmentProcessStation array, a ConveyorBelt and a Calendar. It also throws an IllegalArgumentException if number of stations is less than 3 or greater than 9. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the number of shipments is less than 1.
        Parameters:
        numStations - int number of stations in the simulation.
        numShipments - int number of shipments int he simulation.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        Handles the next event from the EventCalendar updates currentShipment to the shipment that needs to be processed next. Increments stepsTaken by one.

      • getStepsTaken

        public int getStepsTaken()
        Returns the number of steps taken so far.
        Returns:
        stepsTaken int amount of steps taken so far.

      • totalNumberOfSteps

        public int totalNumberOfSteps()
        Returns total number of steps in the simulation. (number of shipments * 2)
        Returns:
        numShipments int total number of steps in the simulation.

      • moreSteps

        public boolean moreSteps()
        Returns true if the simulation has not yet finished. Returns false if it has.
        Returns:
        boolean true if simulation has not finished, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentIndex

        public int getCurrentIndex()
        Returns index of ShipmentProcessStations selected by the currentShipment, or -1 if currentShipment is null.
        Returns:
        idx int index of the current shipment.

      • getCurrentShipmentColor

        public java.awt.Color getCurrentShipmentColor()
        Color of the currentShipment or null if currentShipment is null.
        Returns:
        Color of the current shipment.

      • itemLeftSimulation

        public boolean itemLeftSimulation()
        Returns true if the most recently handled item completed processing and left a shipment process station line. Returns false if the most recently handled item left the conveyor belt to join a shipment process station line, or if there is no current item.
        Returns:
        boolean true if item is no longer waiting in line for processing.

      • averageWaitTime

        public double averageWaitTime()
        Average number of seconds items had to wait in a shipment process station line prior to their actual processing.
        Returns:
        averageWaitTime double average wait time of all the shipments in the simulation.

      • averageProcessTime

        public double averageProcessTime()
        Average number of seconds items spent in actual processing.
        Returns:
        averageProcessTime double average process time of all shipments in the simulation.
